content.description: Same as ghost dancer but end at the first set of chains before the overhang begins!
content.location: First route right of the large crack (herding sheep) on A-Wall

content.description:
One of the better climbs in PR, especially since the death flake was cleaned off in recent years.  Begin just a little left of the 1st bolt and enjoy technical pocket and crimps  through the bottom section to a good rest,  where the climb steepens. Look for the turtle head at the top of the pumpy bulge and keep cranking to the open cold shuts.

 This climb can be damp at the horizontal and might be avoided if that area of the climb is wet/saturated.

 The remnant of the death flake to the right should be avoided, that rock is choss and unstable.
content.location: Fourth route from the left, to the right of Ghost Dancer. There is a section of real junky rock in between this and ghost dancer.

content.description: Fun route on a variety of edges crimps rails... not just pockets, has had some large rocks pull off in the past.
Climbs the crack/groove/general weakness up to a chimney to the top.
content.protection: tricams, tcus/aliens, cams up to #2-#3 camalot the chimney could take bigger if you want to bring it up. Trees for an anchor.
content.location:
2nd route on the left, to the right of Hope. First move is probably the hardest of the whole route. 

  Descent: From the tree you used for an anchor go away from the cliff face and slightly to the right. You should see a gully going down to the right, this is an easy downclimb that will spit you out in the Comic Gallery. This gully can also be used to gain access to the top to rig a top rope for any of the climbs on A Wall.

content.description: Starts off slow. First three bolts are a few feet left of the rest of the route, I have seen the use of extended runners on these three bolts to decrease rope drag, although I think most people just use sport draws, as the rope drag is minimal.
content.location: Third route from the left. To the right of Herding Sheep.

content.description: A Wall along with the Comic Gallery make up the largest concentration of routes at Pictured Rocks. On Sundays When the University has it's classes giving many students their first outdoor climbing experiences, this wall is crowded. The kids usually are done around 2-3 depending on how fast they tire. Other than Sundays, this wall generally isn't that crowded.
